intro: Ruellia macrantha, commonly known as the showy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Ruellia macrantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in warm climates.
